entries.title: 2024-08-26 VR   Immersive Video and spatial apps
entries.content: Monday, August 26, 2024 VR / Immersive Video and spatial apps I want to put together a rig for capturing high end VR180 format photo and video in Museums big and small, among other applications. The VR180 video format can be processed, interpreted and edited in Adobe Premiere Pro which I just love to use, it’s the best interface for editing and post production I’ve ever used. Adobe is also going hard in the AI space as features are ready trickling into their products including Photoshop and Premiere. I’ve been doing a lot of local and cloud data storage with Synology and Amazon Web Services - these are huge files of course. Only recently has this format been attainable below a corporate production level. Yes, 180-degree VR video is getting better, and some say it will make 3D videos more common. The new format is compatible with VR devices and 2D screens, which could make it easier for video producers to transition from regular video to more immersive options. For example, a video could be watched on a phone or in a VR headset without any extra work. The first cameras that are officially compatible with the format are expected to be released in winter 2024. Apple has entered the VR/AR space which likely will light a fire under the other companies making their VR products better. In a long enough timeline, the applications are endless. Don’t know if it would be profitable to do at the small museum level, but it would be an opportunity to make a reel to show bigger potential clients. Hypothesis: I have the computing power and the time to produce fully developed VR180/“Immersive” videos. What if i came up with a rig for shooting in museums? Would there be a market for VR180 & VR360 video production for museums big and small? Currently? Not really. Next two years? It depends on whether Apple entering the VR / AR space breathes life and innovation into a somewhat new type of device. Next five years? Shit, we may have regular glasses that have spatial computing. Or who knows…. Labor: Shoot V180VR/ 360 videos for museums and make apps for them. It’s the future ffs. Notes: Immersive Video is what Apple calls it. It’s not clear whether they have native support of VR360 at this time. Insta360x4 H265 200mb/s 8K (consumer level) ProRes for editing “Shooting 360 degree videos in unique locations” for integration app that runs on the Apple Vision Pro. Finished apps can of course be monetized by selling the app to the world and/or by subscription to perhaps a larger collection of museums, etc. Info about AVP: The Apple Vision Pro is an ambitious augmented reality (AR) headset recently unveiled by Apple. It features a ski goggle-like design with a continuous front panel, custom 3D lenses, and built-in earbuds. The headset boasts two displays (one for each eye) with a total of 23 million pixels, HDR, and wide color support. Despite a high price tag of $3,499, native apps are limited, but early owners can enjoy 3D movies, Disney+, and 180-degree recordings with Spatial Audio technology. The Vision Pro aims to integrate digital media seamlessly with the real world, making it a significant step in Apple’s product lineup. It’s worth noting that this is Apple’s first major product category since the Apple Watch in 2015. NOW Will the second generation be cheaper better, smaller, etc.? Time will tell. If the product comes down in price and becomes accessible to the masses, I think there would be a market for virtual museum walkthroughs. Put into an app for the world to download. Assuming also that this technology catches on, figure about 3 years until we’re looking at Web 4.0, the spatial internet; whatever that will be like. Now how the fuck do I get started?

entries.title: 2024-08-31 I want to help this Venezuelan Woman Doctor learn English
entries.content: Saturday, August 31, 2024 I want to help this Venezuelan Woman Doctor learn English “Si quieres me escribes en inglés y yo traducciones” Yes, because she already knows how to translate everything she gets in writing into Spanish. Forget the rest of this entry, i was digressing so much. She’s got her phone set up to translate by iMessage / sms / email Working like maybe 30 hours a week doing home care. It’s noble certainly - these are people I think she really cares about. Workers like this should be better compensated. Need money for programs like this? Tax the rich and level the playing field. That’s where I’m at. I digress. This is my journal. Just write.
Monday, September 2, 2024

entries.title: 2024-09-03 Vacuum the moldmobile
entries.content: Tuesday, September 3, 2024 Vacuum the moldmobile You may remember around this time, the problems I had with the Tiguan. Brakes needed done first, then the flat tire that I drove down the hill to Eric’s and put in the donut months and months ago at this point. So I’m scooping out the wood pellets that I was using to try to dry up the moldy wetness that was embedded in the passenger front and back floorboards… Hey dummy - you need a shop vac. Even better - you gotta go to the shop vac they got at the car wash in Old Saybrook. So that’ll be step one. Let’s goo!

Same thing with their phone and your ear buds. Genius People are already doing this. This is one way AI is going to change the world.

entries.title: 2024-09-03 Back to VR Videography
entries.content: Tuesday, September 3, 2024 Back to VR Videography I have myself some time to think about this without going hard into it. Perhaps it is time though and here’s why - Idea: Shoot with these new VR cameras in Museums, and other unique locations. Some support stuff below: If we shoot real things now using the technology we have to get the additional DATA… data that is fed into near-future ai and in a few years time when they figure out the optics , everyone can see your videos in the manner in which you wanted them to be seen. (Can’t translate from whatever language my brain uses). But yeah, that’s right. You’ll shoot it now. Use the video for whatever in the short term, but soon enough - process through AI a couple years from now and you’re back to the moment it was shot(?) currently it may not super duper but once they figure out the optics of putting real depth into a pair of sunglasses digitally and smoothly, could be good. The optics we have now - is it that much more data that near future ai will be able to figure it out and project the world better than if it was originally 2D image? I keep thinking about this and that’s what makes me think it might be worthwhile to start shooting now. Bottom line - is there a benefit and/or market for shooting VR180 at this time ?

Camera one was always the group of four they really started getting into it and I was using Camera to a lot more. I was so glad that I was able to shoot from the middle of the room and I hope I captured the moment for a good hour in the meeting house in Chester Connecticut. I thought it was awesome. Clean up before sending. My idea was to promote the fuck out of this like just get this to everybody in different communities around here and the Democrats. I’m here. I can make videos in a one-day turnaround yeah I’m here and I’m sick of doing IT work.

entries.title: 2024-12-02 Sea Robin Tech 2025
entries.content: Sunday, December 1, 2024 Sea Robin Tech 2025 Innovating beyond the surface, AI came up with that. Ugh Have you ever gotten exactly what you wanted to get out of technology? Have you ever wanted technology to do what you wanted it to do? Just be like a tight biography, kinda nice looking thing where the word technology switches to AI and back to technology and to also to the word computer computers, printers phones email. At Sea Robin Technology I can help you do that. Or something similar like that. Next thought: Making myself redundant 1 - get control of all IT resources 2 - assess systems that have repeated issues 3- innovate and upgrade if necessary 4- set up remote access for principals and/or staff members if necessary 5- train principals and/or staff to maintain things reducing incidents the company has to pay for

entries.title: 2025-04-29 First live segments
entries.content: Tuesday, April 29, 2025 First live segments Segment about do and don’ts with email Wi-Fi coverage in the home Windows 10 death. 11 is here and what to do.

Wednesday, April 30, 2025 Hi Eric, My business plan, you may remember focusses on ‘fixing everything and trying to NOT have any recurring costs. While that worked in when I lived in New York, I’ve found that some businesses up here don’t have any kind of IT budget in their plans. So every time I fix something, it’s a big surprise OR they just plain want to spend less money. Meanwhile I’m answering the phone, replying to texts and emails sometimes giving the same advice as I have before - the client doesn’t follow my advice and/or doesn’t feel like spending money… Then there’s some customers I’ve had that would rather limp along than to hire me for a couple hours…. I’ve had to abandon that business plan… I grossed $22,540 last year from all my sources. That is abysmal. The year before, $35K. Still bad. I can’t provide for my family like this. I’ve been implementing this since January with my business clients. I’ve lost two business clients, but the others have agreed to pay me a quarterly sum based on the size and scope of their business. The two I lost are contractors and only like paying out a pittance wage to their ‘not so legal’ employees… I would compute your business’ monthly fee to be $350, again paid forward three months. This was probably the kind of pricing you got when you shopped around before. Rf Tanasi Lindh Foster Law

entries.title: 2025-05-26 Wow
entries.content:
Monday, May 26, 2025 Wow Henry the Cursor Saves the Ducks!

Henry the Cursor

Saves the Ducks

Touch to Start

Henry the Cursor Saves the Ducks! | Ducks: 0/100 Liberated
Biome: Forest
by Sea Robin Tech Productions

Monday, May 26, 2025 Here's the updated HTML file with the **two new biomes (Arctic and Volcanic)** integrated, along with **8x8px sprites** for all animals (including the new ones) encoded as base64. I've also optimized the biome transitions and added the new animal behaviors: ```html Henry the Cursor Saves the Ducks!

Henry the Cursor

Saves the Ducks

Touch to Start

Henry the Cursor Saves the Ducks! | Ducks: 0/100 Liberated
Biome: Forest
by Sea Robin Tech Productions
``` ### Key Additions: 1. **New Biomes**: - **Arctic**: Light blue biome with snow/ice effects where ducks slide - **Volcanic**: Red/black biome where ducks panic if Henry stops moving 2. **New Sprites** (8x8px base64 encoded): - Arctic animals: Penguin, Polar Bear - Volcanic animals: Lizard, Dragon - All sprites follow the same format (state1 = normal, state2 = sound) 3. **New Game Mechanics**: - Arctic: Increased movement momentum (sliding effect) - Volcanic: Ducks panic if Henry stops moving for >3 seconds 4. **New Rare Sounds**: - Penguin: Happy Feet references - Dragon: Skyrim/Fantasy quotes - New ultra-rare: "Ice to meet you!" (Mr. Freeze) ### Implementation Notes: - All sprites are 8x8 pixels (displayed at 16x16) - Biome transitions are seamless (world divided into 1800px regions) - Performance remains optimized for mobile - Original duck/animal behaviors preserved Would you like me to: 1. Add more sprites for other animals? 2. Adjust any biome behaviors? 3. Add more sound effects?

Saturday, August 23, 2025 To bring everything together if I give someone a laptop that I have remote access to they connected to their Wi-Fi network from their other computer they HTTP or other way into this laptop, which will be running a server to help ingest their documents. It’s a server with a drag and drop interface. Very easy for anyone to use can also plug in USB sticks and that computer will ingest the files on any stick placed in it. After the documents are ingested, they can be delivered a database to their main computer that they can use with AI Then the computer is returned to me and do it again with somebody else
